topic.title: Configuring with Provider VLANs and Physical Routers Only

body.p: Another option for configuring Neutron is to use provider VLANs and physical routers only, here are the steps to achieve this.
On your lifecycle manager, make the following changes:

ol.li:
In the ~/helion/my_cloud/config/neutron/neutron.conf.j2 file, change the line below from: router_distributed = {{ router_distributed }}
to: router_distributed = False

In the ~/helion/my_cloud/config/neutron/ml2_conf.ini.j2 file, change the line below from: enable_distributed_routing = True
to: enable_distributed_routing = False

In the ~/helion/my_cloud/config/neutron/dhcp_agent.ini.j2 file, change the line below from: enable_isolated_metadata = {{ neutron_enable_isolated_metadata }}
to: enable_isolated_metadata = True

In the ~/helion/my_cloud/definition/data/control_plane.yml file, remove the following values from the Compute resource service-components list:
- neutron-l3-agent - neutron-metadata-agent
